description: Panama offers a compelling fiscal environment with its territorial tax system and dollarized economy, making it a top choice for retirees prioritizing affordability. The cost of living (Index: 44.3) is significantly lower than in North America, and the Pensionado program provides unmatched benefits. However, prospective residents should be aware that safety (Index: 52.7) and English proficiency (Low) can be hurdles outside of expat bubbles, requiring some cultural adjustment compared to more developed hubs.

visas.name: 180-Day Visa Waiver for Tourists
visas.description: Short‑term entry permission that allows eligible visitors to enter Panama for a limited stay by presenting a valid passport, proof of return or onward travel, and proof of sufficient funds.

visas.name: Pensionado Visa
visas.description: Long‑term residency program aimed at retirees or pensioners; applicants must show a lifetime pension of at least $1,000 per month or qualify through the purchase of Panamanian real estate valued at $100,000 or more.
requirements: Must be a retiree or pensioner with a lifetime pension of at least $1,000 per month.
Purchase real estate in Panama valued at $100,000 or more

visas.name: Friendly Nations Visa
visas.description: Residency option for citizens of qualifying nations; applicants must prove economic or professional ties to Panama—such as employment, business activity, or real estate—and open a Panamanian bank account with at least $5,000 USD.
requirements: Must show proof of economic and professional ties to Panama (this can be employment, business, purchase of real estate)
You must also open a Panamanian bank account with a minimum balance of $5,000 USD.
